{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3542598,"name":"acastagna","username":"acastagna","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T17:32:51.833Z","cooked":"

I have a question regarding using Photon Vision pose estimation. We get a reliable estimated pose back from photonvision, and now are trying to use the add vision measurement feature to update our drive system’s odometry.

However, the pose rotation from the drive odometry is relative to the last time the driver changed the forward direction using seedFieldRelative, and the vision pose esitmate doesn’t account for that, ends up changing which way the robot drives when the stick is pushed forward. How can I deal with this? I thought of just making the rotation standard deviations for the vision measurement really high, but then the fused pose x and y go crazy when the expected rotations dont match.

Any suggestions?

We are using the CTRE generated swerve code for our drive system.

If the rotation from the cameras does not match the rotation of the robot, there may be a problem with your robot to camera rotations. We had the issue I believe you were describing earlier, and after I went and physically measured the cameras position on the robot it fixed itself.
